snippet: Officials say they remain hopeful that Israel has no imminent plans to attack Iran and may be willing to let the United States take the lead in any future strike.
abstract: Obama administration officials say they remain hopeful that Israel has no imminent plans to attack Iran and may be willing to let the United States take the lead in any future military strike; US and Israel intensify talks as Defense Sec Leon E Panetta meets with Israeli Defense Min Ehud Barak; officials say strike would not occur until 2013 at the earliest.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller reported from Ashkelon, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Officials say they remain hopeful that Israel has no imminent plans to attack Iran and may be willing to let the United States take the lead in any future strike.

headline.seo: U.S. and Israel Intensify Talks on Iran Options
headline.main: U.S. and Israel Intensify Talks on Iran Options
headline.print_headline: U.S. And Israel Intensify Talks On Iran Options

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
